nodes.bodyText:
useDebounce debounces a piece of state, meaning a second hook, likely useEffect would be needed to watch the state change and call the callback.
AppBar took a similar approach to what is currently done here with:

  
    
      openEQUELLA/Source/Plugins/Core/com.equella.core/js/tsrc/components/AppBarQuery.tsx
    
    
        Lines 72 to 74
      in
      247dde9
    
    
    
    

        
          
           const [debounceHandler] = useState(() => 
        

        
          
             debounce((value: string) => onChange(value), 500) 
        

        
          
           ); 
        
    
  


It may be good to unify the two approaches, aligning both to leverage useCallback, and/or potentially wrapping them into oEQ's own useDebounce hook.
